label: Customer Journey Orchestration
description: Real-time customer journey mapping and orchestration with AI-driven next-best-action recommendations achieving significant improvement in conversion and customer satisfaction.

traditionalApproach.description: Siloed channel experiences with static journey maps and manual coordination
characteristics: Channel-specific experiences (web, mobile, store operate independently)
Static journey maps created annually in workshops
Manual follow-up workflows via email/call lists
No real-time visibility into customer journey state
Disconnected touchpoints create friction
Reactive response to customer issues
constraints: Customers repeat information across channels
Journey maps outdated within weeks of creation
Significant drop-off due to channel friction
Manual workflows miss timely engagement opportunities
No visibility into journey progress or blockers
Inconsistent experiences across touchpoints

benchmarks.metric: Drop-off Rate Due to Channel Friction
benchmarks.source: TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Multi-channel customer journey friction analysis']

agenticApproach.description: AI-powered real-time journey orchestration with seamless cross-channel experiences and proactive engagement
characteristics: Real-time journey state tracking across all touchpoints
AI recommends next-best-action based on journey stage and behavior
Seamless cross-channel hand-offs (web → mobile → store)
Automated friction detection and resolution
Proactive engagement at optimal moments
Continuous journey optimization through A/B testing
benefits: Significant improvement in conversion through optimized journeys
Real-time visibility enables agile journey improvements
Continuous optimization vs static annual maps

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on AI-powered journey orchestration eliminating friction points and optimizing next-best-actions']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on seamless cross-channel experiences and proactive engagement']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on automated friction detection and real-time resolution']

quickWins: Implement real-time journey tracking for purchase funnel
Deploy next-best-action for abandoned cart recovery
Enable cross-channel hand-off for BOPIS journeys
prerequisites: Customer Data Platform (CDP) for unified customer view
Cross-channel integration (web, mobile, store, call center)
Defined customer journeys and key moments

label: Customer Service & Support
description: AI-powered omnichannel customer service with intelligent routing, self-service automation, and sentiment-driven prioritization achieving high self-service resolution.

traditionalApproach.description: Phone-centric contact center with manual case routing and limited self-service
characteristics: Phone-first support with long hold times
Manual case routing by supervisors
Basic FAQ self-service (low adoption)
No sentiment detection or prioritization
Agents search multiple systems for customer context
Reactive support only (customers must contact)
constraints: Long average hold times
Low self-service resolution rate with most escalating to agent
Manual routing delays urgent cases
Agents lack full customer context (repeat questions)
High cost per contact
No proactive issue detection

Quarterly statement mailings
Limited visibility into program engagement

Static tiers don't recognize engagement behaviors
Low email blast promotion response rates
High program costs as percentage of revenue

No churn prediction or proactive retention

label: Voice of Customer (VoC) Analytics
description: AI-powered customer feedback analysis with sentiment detection, topic modeling, and closed-loop action management achieving significant improvement in NPS.

traditionalApproach.description: Manual survey analysis with spreadsheet-based reporting and limited action closure
characteristics: Email surveys with low response rates
Manual reading and categorization of verbatims
Spreadsheet-based sentiment scoring
Monthly NPS reports (lagging indicator)
Limited follow-up on negative feedback
Insights shared via PowerPoint decks
constraints: Low survey response rates miss majority of feedback
Manual analysis limited to small sample sizes
Insights lag reality by weeks/months
No closed-loop follow-up on issues (customers feel unheard)
Topic categorization subjective and inconsistent
Insights don't drive action (PowerPoint graveyard)

TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Manual verbatim analysis capacity limits']

characteristics: Multi-channel feedback (surveys, reviews, social, support tickets, chat)
AI sentiment analysis on 100% of feedback (not samples)
Automated topic modeling and trend detection
Real-time alerts for negative sentiment spikes
Closed-loop workflows for issue resolution
Predictive analytics on NPS and satisfaction trends
benefits: Complete feedback coverage vs limited survey samples
AI topic detection reveals emerging issues weeks early
Automated analysis scales to millions of feedback points

label: Email Marketing & Automation
description: AI-driven email marketing with behavioral triggers, personalization, and send-time optimization achieving significant improvement in email ROI.

traditionalApproach.description: Batch-and-blast email campaigns with manual segmentation and generic content
characteristics: Weekly promotional email blasts to entire list
Manual segmentation (2-5 broad segments)
Generic email content (same for all recipients)
Fixed send time (Tuesday 10am for everyone)
Manual A/B testing (limited to 2 variants)
Basic open/click reporting
constraints: Low batch-and-blast engagement rates
Generic content irrelevant to most recipients
Fixed send times miss optimal engagement windows
Manual testing limits learning velocity
List fatigue from overuse (unsubscribes increase)
Limited behavioral triggering (abandoned cart only)

AI send-time optimization per recipient
Automated A/B/n testing with multi-armed bandit

Reduced unsubscribes with relevant, timely emails

label: Marketing Attribution & ROI Measurement
description: AI-powered multi-touch attribution with incrementality testing and unified ROI measurement achieving significant improvement in marketing spend efficiency.

traditionalApproach.description: Last-touch attribution with siloed channel reporting and no incrementality measurement
characteristics: Last-touch attribution (100% credit to final click)
Siloed channel reporting (each platform in isolation)
No incrementality testing (can't measure true impact)
Manual ROI calculations in spreadsheets
Gut-feel budget allocation decisions
Quarterly or annual marketing mix modeling
constraints: Last-touch misattributes majority of conversion value
Siloed reporting prevents cross-channel optimization
No way to measure incremental impact (paid vs organic)
Manual calculations error-prone and incomplete
Budget decisions based on incomplete data
Annual MMM too slow for agile marketing

Continuous incrementality testing (geo-lift, holdout tests)
Unified marketing ROI dashboard across all channels
Real-time channel performance analytics
AI-powered budget optimization recommendations
Marketing mix modeling with weekly refresh
benefits: Multi-touch attribution reveals true channel value
Incrementality testing quantifies actual impact (not correlation)
Unified ROI view enables cross-channel optimization
Significant improvement in marketing spend efficiency
Real-time insights enable agile budget shifts
